symptoms.name: Hypopigmented patches
symptoms.severity: Multiple, well-defined, varying sizes (1x2 cm to 4x4 cm)

symptoms.name: Ulcers
symptoms.severity: Solitary ulcer on left thumb (2x2 cm), recurrent ulcers on bilateral lower limbs, one on right lateral malleolus (3x2 cm)

symptoms.name: Neuritis
symptoms.pattern: Thickened nerves (supraorbital, greater auricular, ulnar, common peroneal)

symptoms.name: Loss of sensation
symptoms.pattern: Left ulnar nerve distribution, left foot

symptoms.name: Weakness
symptoms.severity: Weak left-hand grip, weak left-sided reflexes

symptoms.name: Facial nerve palsy
symptoms.severity: Lower motor neuron type, right sided
symptoms.pattern: Incomplete right eye closure, reduced right forehead wrinkles, flattened right nasolabial fold

physical_findings: Multiple well-defined hypopigmented patches over bilateral cheeks
Multiple ichthyotic scaling over bilateral lower limbs
Solitary well-defined ulcer with an erythematous base over the palmar aspect of the left thumb
Solitary well-defined punched-out ulcer over the right lateral malleolus
Thickened left and right supraorbital, right greater auricular, left ulnar, and left common peroneal nerves
Loss of sensation over the left ulnar nerve distribution and over the left foot
Weak left-hand grip with weak left-sided reflexes
Incomplete closure of the right eye
Reduced wrinkles over the right forehead and flattening of the right nasolabial fold

slit skin smear.finding: Initially positive for acid-fast bacilli, negative after four months of treatment

nerve biopsy.finding: Lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate in epineurium, perineurium, and endoneurium; marked epineurial and endoneurial collagenization and hyalinization with marked thickening of the perineurium; epineurial nutrient artery showed thickening of the wall, subintimal fibrosis, and narrowing of the lumen; occasional lepra bacilli on Fite Faraco stain

nerve conduction studies.finding: Asymmetrical sensorimotor axonal peripheral neuropathy worse on the left limbs

required: Clinical presentation consistent with borderline tuberculoid leprosy (hypopigmented patches, ulcers, nerve thickening, sensory loss)
Positive slit skin smear for acid-fast bacilli (initially)
supportive: Histopathological findings consistent with borderline tuberculoid leprosy and type 1 lepra reaction
Response to multidrug therapy and corticosteroids
